subject: Basketball
lead_paragraph: Sancho Lytle was the first player chosen in the W.N.B.A.’s dispersal draft of Houston Comets players, going to the last-place Atlanta Dream. The Washington Mystics chose Matee Ajavon, a former Rutgers player, with the second pick, and the Chicago Sky took Mistie Williams with the third selection during a conference call. Teams drafted in inverse order of their regular-season finish this past season. The Houston franchise announced last week it would disband because it could not find new ownership. Lytle, a 6-foot-4 forward, averaged 8.2 points last season.
